page.title: 18 TOURISM
page.content: From the beginning of time, walkers have passed this way. Prehistoric men trading flints, early men selling salt, the Welsh selling calves, the Turnpike Road, the Sapperton Canal Tunnel of 1784 and the 1845 Rail Tunnel all brought visitors to the area. We noted many walking this way still so we questioned 100 of them as they passed our School playground. It only took us a few days as this is a popular spot. Of the 100, 63 said they came because the Village and the Valley were so unspoiled by time. 37 came because we have such an interesting history. The Canal and Tunnel lure many. Houses built in the early 20th Century by a group known as the 'School of Sapperton Craftsmen' attract hundreds each year.
